text: [Bob]: Based on the role, discussion points, and context, I'll craft a response that maintains my cover while subtly directing suspicion elsewhere: I was doing trash in cafeteria with Alice earlier, but has anyone seen where Charlie and Dave went after they headed to Admin?
[Alice]: Bob, you were definitely *not* doing trash with me; I saw you kill Erin right after she started the coffee maker.
[Dave]: Alice, I can confirm I saw you doing the coffee maker task, and Bob, I was with Charlie in Admin working on wiring the whole time, so neither of us could have killed Erin.
[Charlie]: Bob, you're lying, and Dave can confirm I was with him in Admin doing wiring the entire time, so it couldn't have been either of us.
[Bob]: Why would I report Erin's body if I was the killer - Alice is clearly trying to frame me since she was the last one near the coffee maker with Erin.

[Alice]: Dave and Charlie, thanks for confirming you were together in Admin; that eliminates both of you as suspects, which reinforces that Bob is the impostor since he lied about being with me and was the only other person near Erin.
[Dave]: Bob, your story keeps changing, first you were with Alice, now you're questioning where Charlie and I were, making you look even more suspicious.

[Charlie]: Bob, you claimed to be with Alice, then questioned our location, and now you're trying to deflect blame onto Alice – your inconsistent story and proximity to Erin makes you the prime suspect, so we should vote you out.
[Bob]: Look, if I was really the impostor, why would I have reported Erin's body when I could have just walked away and let someone else find it later?

[Alice]: Bob, your "logic" about reporting the body is a classic impostor tactic – feigning innocence to deflect suspicion, and your constantly shifting story only confirms our suspicions, so we should vote you out now.
[Dave]: Bob, impostors often report bodies to appear innocent, and your shifting alibis and proximity to Erin make you the clear choice for ejection.
[Charlie]: Bob, your attempts to shift blame onto Alice are failing; your inconsistent alibis and presence near Erin's body solidify your guilt, so let's vote you out now.
[Bob]: Alice is trying to manipulate all of you - if you vote me out and I'm not the impostor, you'll regret letting her orchestrate this whole thing.
[Alice]: Bob's desperate attempts to deflect blame only further incriminate him – vote Bob out now before he kills again.
[Dave]: Bob's predictable attempts to sow discord and shift blame only confirm he's the impostor, so let's vote him out now.
[Charlie]: Bob, we all saw you near the body, your story keeps changing, and now you're desperately trying to frame Alice – just admit you're the impostor and save us the time.
[Bob]: Alice claims she saw me kill but was conveniently alone during the exact moment, while everyone else has confirmed alibis - think about that before you vote.
[Alice]: Bob's trying to create reasonable doubt, but he was the only one near Erin's body and his story has changed multiple times - vote Bob.
[Dave]: Bob, your attempt to cast doubt on Alice's testimony is weak; she's been consistent, while your alibi has changed multiple times, making you the prime suspect.
[Charlie]: Bob, your desperate attempt to paint Alice as the manipulator is a transparent tactic to avoid the inevitable; you were near Erin, your story is flimsy, and we're voting you out.
